content.label:
This not only should have included all the bonus dungeons and bosses from previous versions of this title, they should also include the prequel episode FF4 Interlude. 

Not sure why anyone would want to buy a mobile game that has LESS content than much older versions. 

This game is incomplete and much too short.

I am enjoying this version of Final Fantasy IV The after Years, although the absence of The Challenge Dungeons makes it harder and more tedious to level grind outside The Crystals portion of the game. Still, it‚Äôs pretty good. Plus, the graphics were really good.

title.label: Good game, needs update for larger screens

content.label: I loved the initial release on WiiWare and loved this 3D remake. Just wish they‚Äôd fix the screen size issues for larger phones and add mFi controller support.

title.label: Has its flaws but great game

content.label: Just finished the after years and while the beginning of the game can be meh, getting to the crystals makes it more interesting. A lot of random encounters and bosses that can 1-2 hit and can kill you. RIP. Large character selection and bands. Would recommend if you‚Äôre final fantasy fan, if not I‚Äôd start with final fantasy IV

Every other remade Final Fantasy game on the iOS store has controller support. This is the only exception. Even the game before this (Final Fantasy IV) had the majority of the controller support, the analog stick support was the only thing missing, same for FF III. I extremely dislike using touchscreen controls and expected Bluetooth controller support for this game just as it is supported on your other Final Fantasy games for iOS. I will update my review and add 5 stars if the controller support is added.

This game is amazing. The story is deep, the characters are unique(except for maybe Ceodore. Literally just a cardboard cutout of Cecil. Still love him!), and the new moon phases are great!

I actually have one problem though, it‚Äôs not taking any stars, but it is bugging me, why is there no voice acting? FF4 hat it, and it made me feel like the game was reality, gave it more flavor. Plus I‚Äôve always wanted to know what Ceodore sounds like...

Love the whole series. FF4 just happens to be my most cherished of them all so this was a no brainer for me. Loved it. Bands are great!  The bonus dungeons at the end of each chapter are beyond awesome...wait, maybe that‚Äôs the Wii version but anyhow I played them both!  Loved how you got to revisit stuff EXCEPT for the Waterway between Damcyan Castle and Kaipo. Having to go through there sooooooooooo many times became a real chore. Other than that, the story needed alittle more depth but great if your a fan like me!

Played "Yang's Tale" but didn't finish; the save point I used in the game went away after hours of playing when I tried to open the game again. 

It reappeared after I reloaded it for some reason. Not a deal breaker, but disconcerting. There is much to love about this game, and it verges on interactive fiction, which emphasizes the storyline over the martial prowess of characters.  

Storyline is clever, kind of reminds me of Saga Frontier (in that you get to play several different characters, but with better graphics). Square Enix unfortunately has recently been following the lead of more notorious companies by suffocating the genre with IAPs. I hope they change this, because to many fans of this genre, that IS a deal-breaker.

Update this, PLEASE!! Come on! I paid money for this game! I can't STAND this "free" crap that's coming out nowadays! I want quality games that you only have to pay for once! It's been 2 years, UPDATE the App!!!!!

title.label: A Great Sequel To a Great Game

content.label: I first played Final Fantasy 4 on my Nintendo Ds and loved it. I'm a dedicated PS4 player and play a lot of FF XV,FF VI. One day I was scrolling through the AppStore looking for something to play in my car. I then stumbled upon FF 4: The After Years, I bought it instantly. I don't play mobile games, but this game was the exception. I sold my Ds many years ago and I now feel my phone is the replacement for it. The graphics are also really good and crisp,so that's great. (playing games on my phone is a guilty pleasure)

I like the game. It is very interesting. My only problem is what looks like a bug involving Calca, Brina, and Luca where Dance and most Jives attacks keep landing on Luca, even though Dance is suppose to work on all party members and Jive is supposed to only target enemies. Can you figure out what the problem is?

This is an awesome sequel!  Someone spent a lot of time and made the locations on the game very similar to what they were in the first part of the game.  I love knowing what happened to the characters in the previous story.  It is one of the best written stories of the series.

It's almost perfect! But there is ONE FATAL FLAW

Luca crashes the game.
Can we please add cloud saving to this game and ALL other Final Fantasy games.  Wouldn't hurt to add 64bit support to the other games as well.

I've had this for almost a year now and I absolutely love it to no end. I just wish that there was an iCloud saving feature. It'd be perfect since I'm gonna get an iPad soon and what better way to play it than on a much bigger screen

This game was certainly a very very mysterious one to say the least. The way that the story line is set up is genius. Being able to pick and choose between different characters and their individual stories and seeing how they all intertwine with one another to the end is brilliant. And by far the strongest part of this sequel is the mind blowing story line. Although I must say that I was very much intrigued by the incredibly mysterious approach they took with the structuring, it got to be a little frustrating after 40+ hours of gameplay and you still don't know what the blazes is going on! But at the very last moment of the game every finally comes to a head, and I would have to say it's the biggest revelation in all of FF history, making it all worth it. Other that the slightly weak gameplay in comparison to the others, it was an amazing experience and I highly recommend it. EVERY Final Fantasy fan needs this piece of the story puzzle‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è

Before I got this game I had heard some bad things about it, but when my brother got it, I watched it for a bit and he told me about it. A lot of spoilers were said, but when I finally got it, it was frustrating. Ceodores tale is really hard and I was having a lot of trouble. But after that, the game expands into something grand. If you like final fantasy then get this game. IT IS GREAT!!!!
But can you add support to MFI joystick like the rest of all your games? Funny how it works fine on the original FF4 but not this one...

As much as I enjoy the original SquareSoft work, the rest of these reviews are correct. No cloud saving, So when I want to play on lunch on my iPhone 6, new game. SquareEnixs 3rd party needs to go back and fix this app.

If you completed FF4 and loved it , then this game is a must have. I'm honestly enjoying it more than FF4. The story is on point, and even better I'm having no problems with the game crashing  at all. Can't wait to see more of what square enix has to offer... Maybe FF7 üòß.. Or even a kingdoms hearts game? I'm kidding :p... Keep up the good work square enix, ^_^
Seriously, why couldn't SE add the cameo bosses?

This game is amazing and I had a lot of fun playing it. I played both this version and the wii ware version. I totally prefer this. True the challenge dungeons are gone, but all the items from them can be bought in The Crystals chapter. Right outside the lunar whale. As far as not being at a high level. You can buy 5 level bands and gain levels in no time at all to catch up. Had no crashing issues what so ever. Playing on iOS 8 with an iPhone 6 Plus. Highly recommended to all FF IV fans.

Btw what is 16bit support?

Great game pretty much in every way. Some things missing tho :(
So good. I have been a long time FFIV fan. So glad to play through this. A good challenge. Had to grind a little at the end but well worth it.
When I payed $15.99 FOR this game it takes long to install It just gets stuck. Plz stop.

title.label: More like Beta Final Fantasy 4 TAY

content.label:
I loved final fantasy 4 the after years. But this is a disgrace, a disappointment. I loved to see this game with Ds graphics, but NOT without challenge dungeon and other final fantasy bosses. If they would have had 1 month to just perfect and complete this game, and add all features from the original game. Then this game would have been epic.

Just like Sonic Boom, they have tested the debugging before releasing it.

Bottom line is really I would rather pay 40$ for the original than this uncompleted crap. No offense to square enix (they are great), or its developers for trying (well not really trying TO AT LEAST FINISH THE GAME). I love Final Fantasy 4 The After Years, but this remake is disappointing, I would have liked to do all the extra features that the original had in 3D.
So i'd still give a 4/5 Great Game and Story, but needs everything from the original to be Amazing.

One of my favorite FF games of all time was FF IV (2 in US for SNES).  
I came across this gem and wondered how much I might enjoy it compared to the original. I am amazed by the way the individual characters' stories intertwine with the original. Original soundtrack brings back many memories of my youth, playing one of the best games ever. 

If you like FFIV, get this right now!
Don't you guys worry, this game has elements of the first game and it's quite awesome! I insist that SQ must put an save on iCloud since some people might just want to... Cheers!

title.label: Do not buy on new devices.

content.label:
The menus and the game lag very badly on new devices and has poor responsiveness. The resolution is also not updated for the screen on new iPhone devices.

Please update the game for new devices.
sub. spanish.  thank youuuuuuuuuu thanks averybody. :D. im happy.   please. final fantasy I,II please update put subtitles spanish  :D

title.label: Why does this game flip my wallpaper on iPad4?

content.label:
Why does this game flip my wallpaper on iPad4?
Please fix this big, otherwise great game so far.

No challenge dungeons or bosses from 1-6?
More like Final Fantasy IV A Few Years. Why leave out so much of the game? Thank god for the WiiWare version at least. Refund Please!

Also release IV like the PSP version on WiiWare with Cave of Trials and the ability to select who is in your final party.

I love this game, I love the story, characters, and the world, but the bosses are so hard, I can't finish one story because the boss is so hard, please make an update making the bosses easier or at least a difficulty setting
can you please make an update to add the cameo bosses and the challenge by the way this is a good game

i've played the game hoping that they added the cameo bosses from previous FF games in this one, but unfortunately it seems to be unfinished. Square, please update this game so that it's almost similar to the PSP version. i mean, i love facing against gilgamesh. it's not that i don't hate version of the game, but considering that this game has technical issues, i'm hoping that they'd be fixed

Im dissappointed with SE. They went from being my favorite game producers to my most hated. Your remake apps are of horrible quality, something amateurs could do better than. From the graphics to the code. This game is very slow, and I can see each frame go by, on my iphone 5. The only time it is remotely smoothe is when it is on auto battle, and the speed adjustments do nothing. The graphics are pixelated polygon quality at best, and the animations have no work put into them. I was looking forward to finally playing this installment, but Im going to wait until gameplay is actually smoothe and enjoyable. I wouldnt recommend this game until bonus content and graphical and lag issues are addressed.

Some glaring problems, revisiting the SAME DUNGEON for the FIFTH TIME gets tedious, Bands system has changed and is now brainless (possibly a plus?  Think Chrono Trigger techs).

Large story holes and some minor flaws in translation (baron guards say Baron before anything else they say), battle is solid, love the updated graphics.  No challenge dungeons so be prepared for that but the game is still quite enjoyable without them.

FFIV fan must-play, if you've played TAY already don't expect a whole lot of new shtick.  Story gets dull and repetitive at times.
Ok it good

You know, when you remake a game where every previous release had the same content, everyone assumes the latest remake will follow suit. Square, what made you think removing content that ADDED replay value to this game was a good idea. And then failing to mention said content was removed in the description? Either keep the content in the game or just don't bother with the remakes. If you're going to make these games overpriced, the least you could do is keep the bonus content in them.
wonderful game for fans of FFIV. a must have.
Final fantasy is one of the best RPGs ever and I hope to see square Enix makes a sequel to final fantasy vi.

title.label: Why can't SE figure out iCloud save?

content.label: Would be great if I could play on my ipad and iPhone

I don't know why everyone likes this.  There is not one iota of uniqueness except for a couple new characters.  All the dungeons, towns, maps in general, are exactly the same as 4.  I wish I could return this half-assed game.

Thank you SE for a beautiful remake!  The game is near perfection,  it would be a solid appreciation of fans if you would include an option to enjoy the original versions of the music during game play!  I believe it to be only right to include such a feature because music has had a major impact on fans of final fantasy!  Thank you again love us!
Not as good as the other console titles, buts it's alright.

Well the game itself isn't bad. I enjoyed the Wii version... I felt very disappointed that they stripped content from this version. 

I can understand if they took out the challenge dungeons. I'm sure they were used to allow for leveling while the other chapters were released. Still it would have been nice to get an equivalent or something nice for leveling at the end of each chapter.

The final dungeon got super stripped. Where are the FFI-VI bosses? Doom train? Omega? I thought that was real sweet from the Wii version...

I think this content needs to come back somehow at least to give the game a higher replay value.

This game is really good I mean outstanding they remake this into 3D!!!!!!!!!!!! But there is a big problem 1: there is no hidden dungeons. Idk I guess they just want u to do the story mode. 2: 15.00$ for this? I paid for it but I was kind of disappointed but if your going to get a final fantasy game get the 4th one or the 3rd one
Enjoyable game good not great. My biggest problem opening treasure chests I tap and tap and it changes characters some chests have then me 30 secs to open
Awesome game. Great 3D remake but needs iCloud support for saves for multiple devices. Want to pick up from where I left off on my iPad on my iPhone.

Many reviews already mention there are no challenge dungeons in this game, making all the grinding in all the chapters but the last worthless. But there's more bad news: they did not mention that all the bonus bosses in the final dungeon from other cameo FF games are gone and replaced by recycled IV bosses (including ultima weapon). And the fact that you can't farm adamantite to get adamant armor sets for the entire team, but just one set (adamantites are final rewards in challenge dungeons). Plus, you also don't get the developers office (or maybe it's a different location that no one's discovered) where you could trade in items to get more goodies. One of the worst things they did was mess with the final dungeon's layout. It's bad enough the tailed monsters that drop rare tails can be found in a single room in the dungeon, but what's worse is the monster shows up only in 1/4 phase of the moon. Determining which monster is where is practically impossible without a guide, which are all wrong because iOS version is different. This problem could easily be remedied with a siren that triggers rare encounters in a given room, but for some idiotic reason, sirens have been taken out of the game!!!
Where's the voice acting? Why did you take it out. Put it back!!!!
